elements.label: Main Objective: Rout
elements.description: Our aim is simple: utter annihilation of the enemy. Kill them all.

elements.label: Main Objective: Capture
elements.description: The enemy has taken up position here - here, in our homes and our streets. Drive them out and reclaim this city.

elements.label: Main Objective: A Fallen Star
elements.description: Two armies scatter to the wind, and now we may pursue my true target. I have never fought a star before. It might kill me. But I have also never been killed before, either, so who is to say how it might go?

elements.label: Side Objective: Rescue Partisans
elements.description: A group of our comrades is pinned down by the enemy! They'll be lost to us if we do not intervene - up, and to arms! [A chance to obtain new Allies.]

elements.label: Cleft Reality
elements.description: Space folds and ruptures. One step could carry you farther than the eye might see; coordinated movement becomes impossible. We are hemmed in by an invisible labyrinth - but all labyrinths have a heart. If we find the heart of this one, will we be free? [While this card exists, scouting at the Current Warzone will usually fail.]

elements.label: A Skirmish on the Outskirts?
elements.description: A tremendous clamour echoes in the distance, metal and stone crying out like the collapse of a hundred churches. Smoke billows on the horizon. A battle, perhaps - but it would take at least a small army to produce destruction of such an extent. What waits over there?

elements.label: Main Objective: Western Rome
elements.description: German barricades loom in Trastevere; German tanks prowl the perimeter of the Vatican. There are too many fascisti west of the Tiber for my liking - but they do not yet know they have come here to die. I will enlighten them.

elements.label: COMPLETE: West Rome
elements.description: When the sun sets in the west, it will set on the faces of dead fascisti and their broken defences. This third of the city has been won from the occupier.

elements.label: Main Objective: Central Rome
elements.description: Here the ghosts of empire are most visible, but the freshest hauntings are those of the fascisti. The emperor's soldiers once marched these paths - I once marched these paths, and I wore chains when I did. But today, I am free and I am mighty, and no soldier with whip or rifle will make me yield again. Today, I am the only strength worthy of fear.

elements.label: COMPLETE: Central Rome
elements.description: Corpses on the Palatine Hill. The air smells of summer and stinks of blood. This is good; this is well; this is liberation's coming.

elements.label: Main Objective: Eastern Rome
elements.description: The hills on the eastern stretches of Rome teem with fascist guns: Esquilino, Viminale, Quirinale. Buildings rise and fall with the slope of the land - a difficult battlefield; a maze, fighting street-to-street here. But this is our home, and we know the ways through this maze better than those who came as invaders. Yes - these fascisti will die far from home.

elements.label: COMPLETE: Eastern Rome
elements.description: We stand triumphant on the Via del Quirinale. I wonder if He of the Doubled-Spear is pleased by our victory, for though I am the servant of his master's enemy, I have also perhaps restored the dignity of the Colonel's city. Victory is a strange thing.

elements.label: Universit√† Velletri
elements.description: The university's mycology department was frequented by travelling scholars: Germans; Japanese; sometimes Peruvians and sometimes Chinese. Now with the war on, most of the campus has become a barracks for occupying fascist soldiers - but they avoid the mycology building like plague. Someone must be in there, though, for there are always faces in the windows at night.

elements.label: Palazzo Duffari
elements.description: Forty years ago, a troupe of foreign agents tried to exercise their jurisdiction over the Duffoures of Ortucchio - it didn't go well. A third of them died in the shootout that transpired when the family's most infamous son decided to resort to force; another third died in the aftermath, when a compromised agent infected his comrades with a sinister disease. In the end, the palazzo was left in no state for anyone to inhabit. Those who still live in Ortucchio dare not set foot there - only ghosts walk those grounds, they say. I suspect worse things have settled in those ruins.

elements.label: Witching Tree
elements.description: The janare of Benevento would gather on the banks of the Sabato under an ancient walnut tree, riding frenzied on horseback and devouring grisly offerings. Their power was wild; their appetites strange. So it was that the villagers blamed them for the misshapen newborns, and so it was that St. Barbatus tore the tree out by its roots in the name of the Church. Still, on mornings after the Sabbath, the locals sometimes find their horses with plaited manes, frothing from exhaustion.

elements.label: Castello Monforte
elements.description: It's not as large as the word 'castello' might imply, but this hilltop fort has proved devilishly defensible all the same. Any attackers who try to come up the slope of the hill are soundly repelled - which is why for this attack, we will be coming up from under it. 'I could have dug this all by myself when I was younger,' Orsolina says. 'I could have taken this fort all by myself when I was younger. We all age, eh?'

elements.label: Giudetti & Sons Ltd.
elements.description: Giorgiou's burglar - some night-winged, blood-beaked Crow-thing - has made a nest in this ruined dockside warehouse. Its pilfered treasures are no doubt nestled away within, too. 'My associates won't go near - they're superstitous, or cowardly. Me? I'm... nominally courageous, but courage is a thin shield between death and oneself. You're the true fighter here, ergo I think you should be first through the door.'

elements.label: Unseen Encampment
elements.description: Soldiers of the Unseen Legion are making exodus out of Rome, carrying something precious away from the destruction about to befall the city. I don't know what it is, but when I sleep, I can see it in the darkness of my dreams: blinding, searing, shattered.

elements.label: Side Objective: Lorenzo
elements.description: Parts of the Ospedale di Santa Marta have been rendered unsafe thanks to the bombing and gunfighting. Still, behind the wreckage are facilities we are in need of, and could still use. Clearing the debris will be work, but Lorenzo attests that the true danger lies in the bowels of the hospital, where something large and unfriendly has decided to make its nest.

elements.label: Reclaimed Hospital
elements.description: The monster-stink will be gone in short order. In the meantime, we have rooms, beds, and space for the wounded.

elements.label: Side Objective: Fiorenza
elements.description: A band of partisan fighters had attempted to rescue some the locals caught in the zone of engagement. The attempt went badly, and now only twleve partisans remain to protect dozens of civilians: students, children, the old. Holed up in Duomo di San Geraldo, they will only last so long. Fiorenza knows almost every one of those souls. She has begged for assistance in staging her own rescue. Will we be the first ear to listen?

elements.label: Rescued Locals
elements.description: War is not wholly ignoble.

elements.label: Side Objective: Padre Ruggiero
elements.description: Napoli was bombed mercilessly by Allied planes in an attempt to smoke the occupiers out. Too many innocents have perished in the barrages, and it is not uncommon for those wrongfully slain to walk again where the bombing was worst. Enraged? Confused? Unaware? 'It does not matter,' the priest explains. 'God charges us to ease their suffering and permit their passing.'

elements.label: Souls at Peace
elements.description: 'They have gone to the House of the Master, now. They will return to us when the Sun comes again.'

elements.label: Side Objective: Daria
elements.description: For a long time, Daria has been working hard on scrubbing every trace of herself from official record. She had thought the war finished the job for her, but apparently a reserve of government paperwork has been moved to this building by withdrawing fascist elements. 'That part of the city is still under enemy control,' Daria says. 'And the building itself is a good perch for any cecchino worth his salt. But if we move quietly, we should all be able to leave with our heads.'

elements.label: P.O.I. Dossier: Corsino, Daria
elements.description: An old, yellow folder full of someone's secrets. The cover is marked with the emblem of a crown and a sceptre, and below the emblem is a motto rendered in Latin: 'RADIX MALORUM LIBERTAS EST.'
